name: Path of the Thaumaturge
description:
Path of the Thaumaturge is a dungeon-crawler where you pick a starting spell, and pick from 3 random spells every time you level up. The dungeon mode does have an end to it, after 6 floors, but the endless mode ends when you die.

The hospital section of the campaign is a short thing I never finished, which would've allowed the player to have surgery done on them for special abilities.

Path of the Thaumaturge was my very first project with Unity and it taught me a lot about the difficulties of making a project.

Planning, scope, even just being good at writing code are all important, and it's for those reasons that I would probably start from scratch if I were to try to complete this game.

CONTROLS:

TAB - map

F - Pick a spell

WASD - move

mouse - aim | LMB - shoot | RMB - meditate (when skill is unlocked)

SHIFT - run (uses mana)

E - use ladders or doors

I - open inventory (you have to manually equip any items you find, they drop in little brown bags that shine)

R - magic shield (unlock it first)

NUM0 - cheat level up

KNOWN ISSUES:

The dialogue might hang in the beginning, as Fungus can be kind of slow.

When two rooms spawn right next to each other, the tiles of the walls get confused and turn into the default gray squares.
